title: Morristown National Historical Park: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address      Jockey Hollow Visitor Center      (approximate)     580 Tempe Wick Road     Morristown, NJ 07960 Washington's Headquarters Museum      30 Washington Place  Morristown, NJ 07960                 Directions         Morristown National Historical Park is the easiest to see by car. We have 4 different locations throughout the greater Morristown area. Washington's Headquarters Museum and Ford Mansion as well as Jockey Hollow Visitor Center and Wick House are the two main areas of the Park. Detailed directions are on the park website. They are the best places to start and Rangers can give you directions to the Cross Estate Gardens/New Jersey Brigade Area and Fort Nonsense Area of the park.   Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons       Washington's Headquarters MuseumOPEN 9:30 am to 5:00 pm Wednesday through SundayCLOSED Monday and Tuesday as well as Thanksgiving, December 25, and January 1      Please note that the museum will be closed on the following          dates and times:         - Friday, April 15 from 9:30 am to 11:00 am         - Thursday, April 21 from 9:30 am to 10:30 am         - Friday, June 17 from 9:30 am to 11:00 am         - Friday, August 19 from 9:30 am to 11:00 am Ford MansionTour times are 10 am, 11 am, 1 pm, 2 pm, 3 pm, and 4 pm Wednesday through SundayCLOSED Monday and Tuesday as well as Thanksgiving, December 25, and January 1      Please note that there will be no Ford Mansion tours on the        following dates and times:           - Friday, April 15 at 10:00 am           - Thursday, April 21 at 10:00 am           - Friday, June 17 at 10:00 am           - Friday, August 19 at 10:00 am Jockey Hollow Visitor CenterOPEN 9:30 am to 5:00 pm Wednesday through SundayCLOSED Monday and Tuesday as well as Thanksgiving, December 25, and January 1      Please note that the visitor center will be closed on the follow        dates and times:         - Friday, April 15 from 9:30 am to 11:00 am         - Thursday, April 21 from 9:30 am to 11:00 am         - Friday, June 17 from 9:30 am to 11:00 am         - Friday, August 19 from 9:30 am to 11:00 am Wick HouseOPEN 9:30 am to noon and 1:00 pm to 4:00 pm Wednesday through SundayCLOSED Monday and Tuesday as well as Thanksgiving, December 25, and January 1   Park Grounds The operating hours for the park grounds are seasonal, with the grounds opening at 8:00 am but closing hour is dependent on the time of year. Please visit http://www.nps.gov/morr/planyourvisit/hours.htm for the most up to date information.   Standard Hours    Sunday: 8:00 AM - Sunset   Monday: 8:00 AM - Sunset   Tuesday: 8:00 AM - Sunset   Wednesday: 8:00 AM - Sunset   Thursday: 8:00 AM - Sunset   Friday: 8:00 AM - Sunset   Saturday: 8:00 AM - Sunset             Weather           Weather in this part of New Jersey is typical of the mid-Atlantic region.         Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Entrance Fee - $7.00 The entrance fee is a per person fee, is valid for seven open days, and includes entrance into the Washington's Headquarters Museum and Ford Mansion. Visitors 15 years old and younger are FREE. No entrance fee is charged for the Jockey Hollow, New Jersey Brigade, Cross Estate Gardens and Fort Nonsense areas.   Entrance Passes:   Park Pass - $30.00 Valid only at Morristown NHP for 12 months from date of purchase. Permits the card holder and three adults free entrance. Includes: Washington's Headquarters Museum and Ford Mansion Jockey Hollow, New Jersey Brigade, Cross Estate Gardens and Fort Nonsense are free.   Interagency Senior Pass - $10.00 A lifetime pass for citizens or permanent residents of the U.S. age 62 years of age or older. Valid for entrance fees at other National Parks and several other federal agencies. Permits the card holder and three other people entrance.    Interagency Annual Pass - $80.00 An annual pass valid for 12 months from date of purchase. Valid for entrance fees at other National Parks and several other federal agencies. Permits the card holder and three other people entrance.   Interagency Access Pass - $0.00 A lifetime pass for citizens or permanent residents of the U.S. who have a permanent disability regardless of age. Valid for entrance fees at other National Parks and several other federal agencies. Permits the card holder and three other people entrance.   Interagency Annual Military Pass - $0.00 Active duty military members and their dependents qualify for a FREE Annual Pass. Present your valid Common Access Card (CAC) or military dependent ID (DoD Form 1173) for your free Annual Pass. An annual pass valid for 12 months from date of purchase. Valid for entrance fees at other National Parks and several other federal agencies. Permits the card holder and three other people entrance.                Operating Hours & Seasons The park is open year-round, with the exception of a few holidays. This page provides more information about holiday closures, tour times, and park hours.  Fees & Passes Learn more about the entrance fees at Morristown National Historical Park, America the Beautiful passes, and National Park Service fee free days.  Permits & Reservations Get information regarding special use permit, filming permits, and all group reservations. Pets If you plan to visit with your pet, please read this page so that you can make the most out of your visit with your pet. Passport Stamp Sunscreen? Check. Bug spray? Check. Personal road map to America's national parks? CHECK. Commemorate your visit to Morristown with THREE rubber stamps to collect. Brochures Our new park brochure has arrived! Find a digital copy here as well as digital copies of trail maps and other goodies.
